key_channel_insights.line_content: 46.6% of OTA fares exactly match UA.com pricing, demonstrating strong alignment while OTA premiums remain limited.
MSE offers improved with coverage for 48.93% of itineraries, and 47.58% of fares matched UA.com, reflecting steady parity growth.
34.49% of GDS itineraries are priced above UA.com with an average 0.29% markup, highlighting a significant premium tendency.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: 46.6% of OTA fares exactly match UA’s website pricing for the latest week, holding steady week-over-week and month-over-month.
Long-haul routes exhibit OTA markups on 2.31% of origin-destination pairs, averaging a +0.21% premium—nearly double the short-haul markup frequency.
Non-US origin markets show OTA premiums on 7.05% of routes (average +0.08%), compared with just 0.95% for US departures.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: OTA channel did not list 51.6% of UA itineraries last week, a slight increase of 0.21% WoW and 0.24% MoM.
46.60% of OTA listings match UA site prices exactly, with frequency down just 0.27% from the prior week.
1.74% of itineraries carry OTA premiums averaging +0.14%, effectively flat versus last month.
Only 0.09% of listings are cheaper on OTA, with an average -0.11% discount, unchanged month-over-month.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul OTA markups appear on 1.65% of ODs at an average +0.13%, stable compared to prior month.
Long-haul OTA premiums occur on 2.31% of ODs with an average +0.21%, reflecting higher markup concentration on longer routes.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: US departures see OTA premiums on 0.95% of routes, averaging +0.21%, while discounts remain negligible.
Non-US origins carry OTA premiums on 7.05% of routes, averaging +0.08%, indicating stronger premium incidence abroad.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in itineraries feature OTA premiums on 1.87% of bookings, averaging +0.15%, slightly down from last month.
Far-out bookings show OTA premiums on 1.47% of itineraries at +0.11% average, highlighting marginally lower early-cycle markups.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE lacked offers for 51.07% of itineraries last week, but coverage improved by 0.25 percentage points versus the prior month.
47.58% of fares on MSE matched UA.com last week, rising 0.34 percentage points month over month, underscoring sustained alignment.
Non-US itineraries showed a 7.47% incidence of MSE premiums versus just 0.41% for US routes, highlighting significant geographic variance.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Over half (51.07%) of itineraries lacked an MSE offer last week, improving 0.25 percentage points month over month.
Nearly 47.58% of fares matched UA.com, up 0.34 percentage points versus the prior month, indicating stable parity.
1.33% of itineraries were priced above UA.com by an average of 0.14%, with minimal week-to-week variation.
MSE undercuts remained negligible at 0.02% of itineraries, averaging a 0.07% discount week over week.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes saw 48.49% parity last week, up 0.36 pp month over month, with 1.46% of fares at a 0.14% MSE premium.
Long-haul itineraries faced the highest no-offer rate at 57.69%, while only 0.47% showed MSE price premiums averaging +0.18%.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: US-origin routes achieved 48.81% price parity, with just 0.41% of itineraries at a 0.22% MSE markup.
Non-US itineraries exhibited a 7.47% incidence of MSE premiums, averaging a 0.11% markup month over month.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in itineraries matched UA.com 48.07% of the time, up 0.65 pp versus last month, with 1.28% at a 0.16% premium.
Far-out bookings saw 46.62% parity, down 0.27 pp month over month, and 1.42% priced above UA.com by 0.10%.

gds_highlights.line_content: Last week 51.04% of UA routes had no fares on GDS, a 0.12% decline from prior week, indicating minor restoration of inventory visibility.
34.49% of itineraries were pricier on GDS than on UA.com last week, averaging a 0.29% markup and marking a 0.17% week-over-week uptake.
Fares lower than UA.com comprised under 0.01% of routes, delivering an average discount of only 0.15%.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Routes without GDS fares held steady at 51.04% last week, edging down 0.12% from the prior week.
14.47% of itineraries matched UA.com pricing on GDS, unchanged in average difference and virtually flat week-to-week.
GDS fares exceeded UA.com on 34.49% of routes with a 0.29% average premium, up 0.17% week-over-week.
Sub-0.01% of routes saw GDS fares below UA.com, yielding an average 0.15% discount.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: On short-haul routes, 36.12% priced higher on GDS last week, averaging a 0.30% markup and rising 0.16% versus the prior week.
Long-haul routes saw 24.01% GDS premium share with a 0.23% average markup, up 0.22% week-over-week.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: US-origin itineraries had 37.42% priced higher on GDS, averaging a 0.30% markup and climbing 0.29% from the previous week.
Non-US origins recorded 14.78% GDS premiums at a 0.12% average, down 0.57% week-over-week.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings showed 31.15% GDS premiums with a 0.24% markup, up 0.24% from prior week.
Far-out bookings exhibited the highest GDS premium share at 41.09% and a 0.37% markup, marginally up 0.05% week-over-week.
